atDirectives.name: @layer
atDirectives.description: Use the `@layer` directive to organize your custom styles into Tailwind's `base`, `components`, and `utilities` layers.

atDirectives.name: @apply
atDirectives.description: Use the `@apply` directive to inline any existing utility classes into your own custom CSS. This is useful when you find a common utility pattern in your HTML that you’d like to extract to a new component.

atDirectives.name: @screen
@config
atDirectives.description: Use the `@config` directive to specify which Tailwind config file should be used for a particular CSS file.
